Package it.polimi.ingsw.PSP48.client.GUI.sceneControllers

Class DivinityChoiceController

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.PSP48.client.GUI.sceneControllers.DivinityChoiceController
public class DivinityChoiceController
extends java.lang.Object
The controller for divinity chooser Pane

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors 
    Constructor Description
    DivinityChoiceController​(java.util.ArrayList<DivinitiesWithDescription> divinityList, int numberToBeChosen, GameBoardController outerController)
    Initialized the controller

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    void choose()
    Saves in a list the selected divinity, deletes the chosen divinity from the list of available divinities and - if there are other divinities to be selected, changes the visible divinity and asks player to choose another divinity - else notify the view that the player completed divinities selection
    void clickedChoose()
    Changes choose button image until mouse isn't released, to make pressed button effect
    void clickedNext()
    Changes next button image until mouse isn't released, to make pressed button effect
    void clickedPrev()
    Changes prev button image until mouse isn't released, to make pressed button effect
    void firstDivinity()
    Set as visible the first divinity in the list, hides prev button and updates next button
    void initialize()
    Initializer method for FXML load, sets visible the first divinity, and then updates the next button with the next divinity (if there are more than one divinities)
    void lastDivinity()
    Set as visible the last divinity in the list, hides next button and updates prev button
    void nextDivinity()
    Set the next divinity in the divinity list as the visible, and: -if the new current divinity isn't neither the last or the first, sets the new previous and new next divinities name on next and previous buttons; -if the new current divinity is the last divinity in the list, updates only the previous button, hiding the next button
    void prevDivinity()
    Set the previous divinity in the divinity list as the visible, and: -if the new current divinity isn't neither the last or the first, sets the new previous and new next divinities name on next and previous buttons; -if the new current divinity is the first divinity in the list, updates only the next button, hiding the previous button
    void releasedChoose()
    Restore choose button background when the mouse is released
    void releasedNext()
    Restore next button background when the mouse is released
    void releasedPrev()
    Restore prev button background when the mouse is released

    Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

    equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

  • Constructor Details

    • DivinityChoiceController

      public DivinityChoiceController​(java.util.ArrayList<DivinitiesWithDescription> divinityList, int numberToBeChosen, GameBoardController outerController)
      Initialized the controller
      Parameters:
      divinityList - the list of divinities from which the player can choose
      numberToBeChosen - the number of divinities to be chosen
      outerController - the controller of the game board's scene

  • Method Details

    • initialize

      public void initialize()
      Initializer method for FXML load, sets visible the first divinity, and then updates the next button with the next divinity (if there are more than one divinities)

    • nextDivinity

      public void nextDivinity()
      Set the next divinity in the divinity list as the visible, and: -if the new current divinity isn't neither the last or the first, sets the new previous and new next divinities name on next and previous buttons; -if the new current divinity is the last divinity in the list, updates only the previous button, hiding the next button

    • prevDivinity

      public void prevDivinity()
      Set the previous divinity in the divinity list as the visible, and: -if the new current divinity isn't neither the last or the first, sets the new previous and new next divinities name on next and previous buttons; -if the new current divinity is the first divinity in the list, updates only the next button, hiding the previous button

    • clickedNext

      public void clickedNext()
      Changes next button image until mouse isn't released, to make pressed button effect

    • releasedNext

      public void releasedNext()
      Restore next button background when the mouse is released

    • clickedPrev

      public void clickedPrev()
      Changes prev button image until mouse isn't released, to make pressed button effect

    • releasedPrev

      public void releasedPrev()
      Restore prev button background when the mouse is released

    • choose

      public void choose()
      Saves in a list the selected divinity, deletes the chosen divinity from the list of available divinities and - if there are other divinities to be selected, changes the visible divinity and asks player to choose another divinity - else notify the view that the player completed divinities selection

    • firstDivinity

      public void firstDivinity()
      Set as visible the first divinity in the list, hides prev button and updates next button
